result.execSummary:
Alexander W Mendez was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Alexander W Mendez was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander W Mendez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alexander W Mendez not in court.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
Defendant has been extradited.
State moves to dismiss.
BTC:  Dismiss.

Defendant Alexander W Mendez in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Alexander W Mendez in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
State of IL req extradition.
Defendant does not contest.
Colloquy conducted with def re: right to hearing.
BTC:  The court finds that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly, & intelligently waives extradition.

Defendant Alexander W Mendez in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Alexander W Mendez in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.  Review hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
